AmplitudeEnvelope.description: Trigger the attack/decay portion of the ADSR envelope.

params.description: When the attack should start.
params.name: time

params.description:
The velocity of the envelope scales the vales.
                              number between 0-1
params.name: velocity

examples:
//trigger the attack 0.5 seconds from now with a velocity of 0.2
 env.triggerAttack("+0.5", 0.2);
AmplitudeEnvelope.name: triggerAttack

AmplitudeEnvelope.description: Triggers the release of the envelope.

params.description: When the release portion of the envelope should start.
params.name: time

examples:
//trigger release immediately
 env.triggerRelease();
AmplitudeEnvelope.name: triggerRelease

AmplitudeEnvelope.description:
triggerAttackRelease is shorthand for triggerAttack, then waiting
 some duration, then triggerRelease.

params.description: The duration of the sustain.
params.name: duration

params.description: When the attack should be triggered.
params.name: time

params.description: The velocity of the envelope.
params.name: velocity

examples:
//trigger the attack and then the release after 0.6 seconds.
env.triggerAttackRelease(0.6);
AmplitudeEnvelope.name: triggerAttackRelease

Tone.description:
Set the parameters at once. Either pass in an
 object mapping parameters to values, or to set a
 single parameter, by passing in a string and value.
 The last argument is an optional ramp time which 
 will ramp any signal values to their destination value
 over the duration of the rampTime.
examples: filter.set("type", "highpass");
Tone.name: set

Tone.description:
Get the object's attributes. Given no arguments get
 will return all available object properties and their corresponding
 values. Pass in a single attribute to retrieve or an array
 of attributes. The attribute strings can also include a "."
 to access deeper properties.

params.description:
the parameters to get, otherwise will return 
 					                  all available.
params.name: params

examples:
osc.get();
//returns {"type" : "sine", "frequency" : 440, ...etc}

osc.get("type");
//returns { "type" : "sine"}
Tone.name: get

returns.description: returns the name of the class as a string

Note.description:
Parses a score and registers all of the notes along the timeline.

Scores are a JSON object with instruments at the top level and an array of time and values. The value of a note can be 0 or more parameters.

The only requirement for the score format is that the time is the first (or only) value in the array. All other values are optional and will be passed into the callback function registered using `Note.route(channelName, callback)`.

To convert MIDI files to score notation, take a look at utils/MidiToScore.js

returns.description: an array of all of the notes that were created

Note.name: parseScore

Transport.description:

 at the `interval` starting at the `startTime` and for the specified
 `duration`.

The ID of the scheduled event. Use this to cancel
                          the event.

 envelope has fully released.

examples: sampler.triggerRelease();

params.description: The note to trigger.
params.name: note

params.description:
How long the note should be held for before
                         triggering the release.
params.name: duration

params.description: When the note should be triggered.
params.name: time

params.description: The velocity the note should be triggered at.
params.name: velocity

examples:
//trigger "C4" for the duration of an 8th note
synth.triggerAttackRelease("C4", "8n");
Sampler.name: triggerAttackRelease

SimpleAM.description: Trigger the attack of the note optionally with a given velocity.

params.description: The note to trigger.
params.name: note

params.description: When the note should start.
params.name: time

params.description:
velocity The velocity scaler 
                               determines how "loud" the note 
                               will be triggered.
params.name: velocity

examples: synth.triggerAttack("C4");

//trigger the note a half second from now at half velocity
synth.triggerAttack("C4", "+0.5", 0.5);
SimpleAM.name: triggerAttack

SimpleAM.description: Trigger the release portion of the envelope

params.description: If no time is given, the release happens immediatly
params.name: time

examples: synth.triggerRelease();
SimpleAM.name: triggerRelease

SimpleAM.description:
Set the note at the given time. If no time is given, the note
 will set immediately.

params.description: The note to change to.
params.name: note

params.description: The time when the note should be set.
params.name: time

examples:
//change to F#6 in one quarter note from now.
synth.setNote("F#6", "+4n");

//change to Bb4 right now
synth.setNote("Bb4");
SimpleAM.name: setNote

Add.description: Schedules a parameter value change at the given time.

params.description: The value to set the signal.
params.name: value

params.description: The time when the change should occur.
params.name: time

examples:
//set the frequency to "G4" in exactly 1 second from now. 
freq.setValueAtTime("G4", "+1");
Add.name: setValueAtTime

Add.description:
Creates a schedule point with the current value at the current time.
 This is useful for creating an automation anchor point in order to 
 schedule changes from the current value.

params.description: (Optionally) pass the now value in.
params.name: now

Add.name: setRampPoint

Add.description:
Schedules a linear continuous change in parameter value from the 
 previous scheduled parameter value to the given value.
Add.name: linearRampToValueAtTime

Add.description:
Schedules an exponential continuous change in parameter value from 
 the previous scheduled parameter value to the given value.
Add.name: exponentialRampToValueAtTime

Add.description:
Schedules an exponential continuous change in parameter value from 
 the current time and current value to the given value over the 
 duration of the rampTime.

params.description: The value to ramp to.
params.name: value

params.description:
the time that it takes the 
                              value to ramp from it's current value
params.name: rampTime

examples:
//exponentially ramp to the value 2 over 4 seconds. 
signal.exponentialRampToValue(2, 4);
Add.name: exponentialRampToValue

Add.description:
Schedules an linear continuous change in parameter value from 
 the current time and current value to the given value over the 
 duration of the rampTime.

params.description: The value to ramp to.
params.name: value

params.description:
the time that it takes the 
                              value to ramp from it's current value
params.name: rampTime

examples:
//linearly ramp to the value 4 over 3 seconds. 
signal.linearRampToValue(4, 3);
Add.name: linearRampToValue

Add.description:
Start exponentially approaching the target value at the given time with
 a rate having the given time constant.
Add.name: setTargetAtTime

Add.description:
Sets an array of arbitrary parameter values starting at the given time
 for the given duration.
Add.name: setValueCurveAtTime

Add.description:
Cancels all scheduled parameter changes with times greater than or 
 equal to startTime.
Add.name: cancelScheduledValues

Add.description:
Ramps to the given value over the duration of the rampTime. 
 Automatically selects the best ramp type (exponential or linear)
 depending on the `units` of the signal

params.description:
the time that it takes the 
                              value to ramp from it's current value
params.name: rampTime

Add.name: rampTo

Cancels all scheduled parameter changes with times greater than or

TimelineSignal.description:
Sets the computed value at the given time. This provides
 a point from which a linear or exponential curve
 can be scheduled after. Will cancel events after 
 the given time and shorten the currently scheduled
 linear or exponential ramp so that it ends at `time` .
 This is to avoid discontinuities and clicks in envelopes.

params.description: When to set the ramp point
params.name: time

TimelineSignal.name: setRampPoint

The ending anchor point by which the value of
                      the signal will equal the given value.
